story.name: 15 Top Meeting Notes Apps (Read Before Buying!) Test

content.text: to miss important points or action items during a long meeting, which is why meeting notes apps have become increasingly popular in 2025.
But here’s the catch: not all tools are created equal. Some lack essential features, others don’t work at all, and a few are outright scams.
To save you time and frustration, we spent over
different tools to see which ones actually increase your productivity.
In this guide, we’ll explore 15 picks for the best meeting notes software to help you stay organized and make every meeting count.

body.description: What makes the best meeting note app?

content.text: What makes the best meeting note app?
Before discussing each tool in depth, I’ll quickly explain our selection criteria for this list.
: The software should be simple to use so you can focus on the meeting, not the tool.
: Look for tools that turn speech into text quickly and accurately, even in live conversations.
: Make sure it’s easy to share notes with your team or clients right after the meeting.
: Choose software that works across different devices like phones, tablets, and computers.
: Pick a tool that fits your budget, whether it’s free or a paid plan.
These simple criteria will help you pick an AI note-taking tool that saves time, keeps you organized, and ensures you never miss important details.

body.description: 15 best meeting note apps and software

content.text: 15 best meeting note apps and software
Let’s review the best meeting note apps that
make it easy to take, edit, and share
#1 Notta: Best for automatic note-taking and summary

tops the list by generating meeting transcripts in real time with an impressive accuracy of up to 98.86%. Combine that with AI-powered summaries of meeting highlights, and you’ll never miss any important details again.

You can convert live meetings or recordings into full transcripts in 58 languages, so it’s a great choice for international teams. You can translate the finished transcripts in 42 different languages, including Japanese, Hindi, and Arabic.
The tool also helps you collaborate with your team members using numerous sharing options, so no one misses out on key information.
and gives you accurate, detailed notes and summaries:
Transcribes your conversations to text in real-time
Lets you easily review, edit, and highlight meeting notes for accuracy and flow with built-in tools
Allows you to insert images to make the content easier to understand
Shares meeting notes easily via links
records online meetings in high-quality audio and video,
rewatch past meetings or share them with teammates who didn’t attend.
can’t attend, Notta has a simple solution. Connect its
AI meeting assistant to your calendar, and it will automatically join and transcribe your Zoom, Google Meet, Microsoft Teams, and Webex meetings.
Highly accurate automatic transcriptions from real-time meetings or uploaded files
AI-powered meeting summaries with chapters and action items

body.title: Run effective team meetings with Notta
body.description: Notta AI meeting assistant records, transcribes, and summarizes meetings so everyone can stay engaged without missing important details.

content.text: #2 Spinach AI: Best for taking meeting minutes
, formerly Hypercontext or Soapbox, is a meeting agenda and notes tool that primarily focuses on automating post-meeting tasks.
You can use it to document conversations and action items throughout your meeting, and search for specific keywords or phrases in your automated notes to find important information quickly.

Spinach AI also introduced an AI voice command feature that integrates with project management tools like Jira and Trello to help you manage and complete tasks. Its friendly user interface makes it intuitive and accessible without watching through countless tutorials.
Automated meeting minutes with AI-powered insights
Automatically sets due dates and assigns next steps
Collaborative meeting agendas with file and link attachments
Numerous integrations, from MS Teams and Google Meet to Slack and Asana

body.code:
ProsCons

Designed for one-on-ones, team meetings, performance reviews, and more

content.text: is a well-known workspace for teams that need to centralize their note-taking and project management.

The platform can also be used to manage and document virtual meetings because it integrates with platforms like Zoom. This supports team collaboration, as every member can access schedules, view important details about the call, and join meetings directly from Notion.

organize your meeting notes. You can sort long meetings into categories and tag them so they’re easier to find. Then, track meetings and attendees, and use any of Notion’s hundreds of note templates to structure your discussion.

Notion recently added Enterprise Search, a feature that lets you search across external platforms like Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive. It helps save time by giving you access to all your team’s data in one place, no matter where it’s stored.

Although Notion introduced AI Meeting Notes in beta back in May, it's still in beta testing and lacks key features like speaker detection and integrations with other apps. If you’re looking for dependable, automatic meeting transcripts, you’re better off with a purpose-built tool like Notta. Bonus: Notta already integrates with Notion!

content.text: allows users to create digital notebooks and quickly scan and store notes, documents, audio recordings, videos, images, and more.
One of the best features of OneNote is its ability to sync data across all devices, so you always have up-to-date documents no matter where you are.

It also offers several features that enhance the note-taking process, including easy sharing, advanced search options, and the ability to attach and organize multimedia content right in your notebook.
If you prefer the old-school method of note-taking, OneNote even allows you to scan handwritten notes and search them as text using handwriting recognition.
The platform integrates with Microsoft Office 365 and Outlook Accounts, making it a good option for users already accustomed to the Microsoft platform.
Voice transcription for recording real-time meetings

content.text: is a note-taking app known for its
ability to sync across different devices. This allows you to stay focused, productive, and organized on both your personal phone and your work computer.

Evernote is built for a variety of note-taking needs, including work, personal, and school-related. For example, if you use Evernote for work, relevant features include real-time collaboration on notes, task assignments with notifications, and shared Spaces.
Evernote also has AI features like Smart Search and Note Cleanup to save you time when formatting and referencing your notes.
For multitaskers, the new AI Text-to-Voice feature can read your notes, emails, or other documents aloud while you’re busy working on other projects.

content.text: allows users to create a web of interconnected notes, meaning you can group related notes together by creating links among concepts and ideas. This is a helpful way to organize minutes for different types of virtual meetings, and you can even visualize the links between your notes in a graph format.
Obsidian is also highly customizable with hundreds of plugins and an open API. For example, v1.9.0 introduced a new core plugin, ‘

content.text: is primarily a project management solution, it also offers some basic meeting notes features. When you use the tool to take notes, you’ll get a record of the meeting agenda, discussion notes, follow-up actions, and key decisions.
nTask lets you start Zoom, MS Teams, or Google Meet calls directly from the app. You can also sync nTask with your calendar events to schedule meetings and set up your agenda ahead of time.
Once notes are completed, you can choose to submit them for review by all meeting participants or publish and share them directly on nTask.

body.title: Run effective team meetings with Notta
body.description: Notta AI meeting assistant records, transcribes, and summarizes meetings so everyone can stay engaged without missing important details.

content.text: Say goodbye to tedious note-taking and hello to seamless meeting transcriptions with Notta’s AI-powered solution.
Fellow: Best for meeting agenda templates
is an all-purpose meeting management app that allows you to record meeting notes, build meeting agendas, share and receive feedback, and assign action items.

The tool’s meeting assistant can transcribe your calls and produce AI-generated highlights with shareable recaps. You can also delegate, visualize, and prioritize any next steps and sync them with your project management tool.
Something that sets Fellow apart is its range of meeting notes and agenda templates
You can choose any template you want and save the time you would have spent creating your own.
While Fellow brings useful tools to the table, its transcription accuracy leaves room for improvement, especially compared to Notta’s precision.
Detailed, collaborative summaries with an accurate record of decisions
AI meeting highlights of important moments
Connects with Google Meet, MS Teams, and Zoom

body.code:
ProsCons
AI assistant to answer questions about meetingsSome G2 users have issues with the search feature
Over 500 meeting agenda and minutes templates are available
Over 50 integrations

content.text: MeetingBooster: Best for organizing meeting notes
’s strongest point is its note-organizing features that allow teams to easily order, categorize, store, and recall their notes.

With MeetingBooster, it’s easy to assign action items right from your meetings. You can share detailed notes via email as a PDF or using a link, as well as archive all your notes with secure, encrypted storage.
The platform also has a dedicated meeting agenda module with pre-built templates so you can create instant agendas.
Assign and edit action items within notes
Numerous meeting minute templates are available
Access control for historical log of key points
Additional tools for instant meeting agenda creation
Meeting Series module for recurring meetings

content.text: #11 Zoho Notebook: Best for Zoho users

lets users record various types of notes, including text, checklists, audio, photos, and documents. The platform calls these Note Cards, which provide an appropriate interface for the specific type of notes you want to take.
For example, you can record long meetings with an Audio Card and then create a list of the next steps and action items with a Checklist Card.
You can then share your notes securely and collaborate with coworkers.
Real-time collaboration within notes, with the ability to view, edit, and share
Comes with Noteboard project management tool for tracking task progress
Interactive digital whiteboard for sharing ideas between or on calls

Integrations with Google Suite, Microsoft Teams, and Slack
is a versatile application that lets you turn handwritten or typed text into neatly formatted notes.

A key feature of this platform is the ability to take notes with a stylus and then convert them into text. That means you can write notes on your tablet during a meeting, and those notes will show up alongside your meeting recording for easy reference.

Notability offers a variety of other features, including note sharing, audio recording, and PDF annotation. It’s available on multiple platforms, including iOS, Mac, Windows, and Chrome, with a user-friendly interface and a clean, minimal layout.

You can quickly add text, images, and reminders to your notes with Keep, as well as create lists, assign tasks to specific people, and color-code items for easier organization.
The app also allows you to collaborate and share unlimited notes with other people. You can also sync them across all your devices so that you always have your notes on hand.

has an intuitive interface that’s easy to navigate, with features that help users create extremely organized documents.

The platform supports multiple types of media, which allows users to combine their notes with images or PDFs in the same space. It also includes AI-powered search that helps you quickly find information. Plus, its customization options let you personalize the app.

content.text: #15 Apple Notes: Best for Apple users
is a straightforward yet convenient note-taking app, a good fit for those looking for an easy-to-use solution to keep their meeting notes organized.
The tool is user-friendly and provides options to save, tag, and sort all your notes for easy access.

It also has helpful integrations with other Apple apps like Mail and Reminders, so you can stay connected across your devices. Additionally, the option to create checklists makes it easy to plan out tasks quickly and easily.

body.description: Why take meeting minutes using dedicated note-taking software

content.text: Why take meeting minutes using dedicated note-taking software
Taking meeting minutes with note-taking software is better than taking manual notes because it saves time, reduces the chance of human error, and ensures that you don't miss important details.
There’s a range of specialized note-taking software on the market that makes recording meetings quick and efficient for remote and in-house employees.
AI notetakers allow you to access, edit, and share meeting notes across devices to help your team stay informed and accountable.

Unlike manual note-taking, AI software can reduce the risk of information getting lost or misinterpreted. You also don’t have to worry about data security, as most reputable apps use strong encryption and strictly limit third-party access.

body.description: Enhance productivity with the top meeting notes app

content.text: Enhance productivity with the top meeting notes app

When choosing meeting notes software, consider which features are most relevant to your work. Do you need highly accurate transcripts? Or are you looking for a platform that makes organizing and linking notes easier?

Remember that not all note-taking apps are trustworthy. Free tools are often limited and may expose your data. Plus, they're much less accurate than professional apps like Notta, so you'll spend lots of time making edits after every meeting.

For an all-around productivity tool and a reliable way to transcribe meeting minutes, Notta is the best app for meeting notes. You can use the tool to record your calls, revisit past meetings, accurately transcribe your discussions,
, generate key action items, and translate your highlights into over 40 languages.
